string.text: Standard 20-caliber shell filled with 5 6mm buckshot pellets. Highly lethal at close range. Due to the reduced powder charge it suffers from reduced power compared to 12 gauge shotguns. The lighter recoil makes it more popular for novice hunters. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.

Single-barreled 20 gauge hunting shotgun with sliding breech bolt. Widely known by it vernacular name, the Death of the Chairman, for its compact size.
 This is a model with a folding stock, and very small magazine capacity.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS:
 %c[d_purple] - %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes: None
 %c[d_purple] - %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: None

Single-barreled 20 gaige hunting shotgun with sliding breech bolt. Widely known by it vernacular name, the Death of the Chairman, for its compact size.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS:
 %c[d_purple] - %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes: Due to the position of the stock, it is possible to install sights only with a very low mount: Barska AC10632, C-More, Docter Sight, Aimpoint T1, Trijicon RMR, Leupold DeltaPoint PRO, OKP-7, 1P76 Rakurs.
 %c[d_purple] - %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: None
